snippet: Military and police planes began airlifting tourists from the resort town of Los Cabos on Tuesday as residents began to tally the wreckage left by Hurricane Odile.
abstract: Military and police planes begin airlifting tourists from resort town of Los Cabos, Mexico, as residents begin to tally wreckage from Hurricane Odile; storm was strongest to hit the Baja California peninsula in almost 50 years.
lead_paragraph: Military and police planes began airlifting tourists from the resort town of Los Cabos on Tuesday as residents began to tally the wreckage left by Hurricane Odile.

headline.main: Mexico: Tourists Being Airlifted After Hurricane Odile
headline.print_headline: Mexico: Tourists Being Airlifted After Hurricane Odile
